questions.text: The best treatment option for a fracture Shaft of the femur in a 4 years child is?

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate application of a hip Spica cast

options.label: C
options.text: Skeletal traction for 2 weeks followed by application of a hip Spica cast

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate application of a hip Spica cast
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Immediate application of a hip Spica cast This is a plaster cast incorporating part of the trunk and the limb. It may be a single Spica (involving only the fractured limb) or one-and-a-half limb. It can be safely used for immobilizing these fractures in children.

Highyeild:

Hip Spica: This is a plaster cast incorporating part of the trunk and the limb. It may be a single Spica (involving only the fractured limb) or one-and-a-half limb. It can be safely used for immobilizing these fractures in children.

questions.text: A 24-year-old female came with a history of road traffic student and complained of pain over the right thigh region. A splint was applied and an X-ray was taken. All of the following statements are true about this splint except?

options.label: A
options.text: The ring is at an angle of 120 degrees to the inside bar

options.label: B
options.text: The ring size is found by the addition of 2 inches to the thigh circumference at the highest point of groin

options.label: C
options.text: The length of this splint is the measurement from the highest point on the medial side of the groin up to the heel plus 6 inches

options.label: D
options.text: The outside bar has a curvature near its junction with the ring to accommodate the lesser trochanter

questions.correct_answer: D. The outside bar has a curvature near its junction with the ring to accommodate the lesser trochanter
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The outside bar has a curvature near its junction with the ring to accommodate the lesser trochanter The image shows the picture of a Thomas splin The outside bar has a curvature near its junction with the ring to accommodate the greater trochanter and not lesser trochanter.

Highyeild:

Thomas's splint is one of the commonest splints used in orthopedic practice. It was devised by H.O. Thomas, initially for the immobilization of tuberculosis of the knee. It is now commonly used for the immobilization of hip and thigh injuries. A Thomas splint has a ring and two sidebars joined distally. The ring is at an angle of 120 degrees to the inside bar. The outside bar has a curvature near its junction with the ring to accommodate the greater trochanter. Size of a Thomas splint is measured by finding the ring size and the length of the splint. The ring size is found by the addition of 2 inches to the thigh circumference at the highest point of the groin. The length of a Thomas splint is the measurement from the highest point on the medial side of the groin up to the heel plus 6 inches.

questions.text: A 66-year-old woman came in with pain and swelling over the left hip region. An X-ray was taken and an intertrochanteric fracture was diagnosed. She was placed on a splint till the patient was fit for surgery. Name the splint?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bohler-Braun splint Bohler-Braun splint has several pulleys (1-3) over which the traction cord passes while giving traction for different fractures. It is more convenient than Thomas's splint since it has no ring. The ring of a Thomas splint is a common cause of discomfort, especially in elderly people. A Bohler-Braun splint has no inbuilt system of counteraction, hence it is not suitable for transportation.

questions.text: A 66-year-old female came with a history of accidental falls at home and complained of pain over the right hip with an externally rotated lower limb. The patient was placed on the following traction as shown in the image. All the following are complications of this traction except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pin tract infection/osteomyelitis Skin traction is noninvasive and Pin tract infection/osteomyelitis is a complication of skeletal traction which is invasive.

Highyeild:

This is a case of fracture neck of the femur for which skin traction is applied. There are 2 types of traction- Skin traction: An adhesive strip is applied on the skin and traction is applied. The traction force is transmitted from the skin through the deep fascia and intermuscular septae to the bone. Skeletal traction: The traction is applied directly on the bone by inserting a K-wire or Steinmann pin through the bone. Complications of skin traction include – Blistering of the underlying ( Option A. ..) Distal limb ischemia. ( Option B. ) Allergic reactions to adhesives. ( Option D. ) Peeling/sloughing of skin. Pin tract infection/osteomyelitis is a complication of skeletal traction due to the Steinman pin inserted through the bone.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Above is skin traction and blistering may occur due to tight application and edema. Option: B. Distal limb ischemia may occur due to tight application and subsequent compression of blood vessels. Option: D. Allergic reaction to adhesives is a complication.

Dunlop traction Dunlop Traction is a type of skin traction given for supracondylar fracture of the It is placed along the axis of the forearm as well as at right angles to the humerus using a broad sling placed around the upper arm.
